Operation 'language-detection' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary 'Language Detection' is too generic and not action-oriented. Description lacks critical details about input format (array of texts), output structure (array of results with language_code), and handling of edge cases. Added specificity about request/response format, supported language constraints, and potential edge case handling to improve AI agent interpretability and help agents understand exactly what to send and what to expect.

data.current_description:
Identifies what language a text is written in. Only languages that our API supports can be analyzed.

Returned labels:
* language_code of the detected language
data.description_suggestion: Detects the language of provided text input and returns the identified language code. Supports a limited set of languages - only languages in the API's supported language list can be accurately detected. Accepts an array of text strings in the request body and returns an array of language detection results, each containing the detected language_code for the corresponding input text. Unsupported languages may return null or a confidence score indicating detection uncertainty.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Language Detection' is too generic and not action-oriented. Description lacks critical details about input format (array of texts), output structure (array of results with language_code), and handling of edge cases. Added specificity about request/response format, supported language constraints, and potential edge case handling to improve AI agent interpretability and help agents understand exactly what to send and what to expect.

data.current_description:
Identify the purpose and writing style of a written text.

 Supported Languages: [`ar`, `de`, `en`, `es`, `fr`, `it`, `nl`, `pt`, `ru`, `tr`, `zh`]

Returned labels:
* action-seeking
* fact-oriented
* information-seeking
 * self-revealing
data.summary_suggestion: Analyze text communication purpose and writing style
data.description_suggestion: Analyzes written text to identify its communication purpose and writing style. Classifies text into categories including action-seeking, fact-oriented, information-seeking, and self-revealing. Supports 11 languages: Arabic, German, English, Spanish, French, Italian, Dutch, Portuguese, Russian, Turkish, and Chinese. Returns classification labels indicating the primary communication intent and stylistic characteristics of the input text.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Communication & Tonality' is too vague and uses ampersand notation. Description lacks clarity about what the operation returns and doesn't explicitly list supported languages in readable format. Enhanced summary to be action-oriented and description to clarify outputs and language support for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
Detect the emotions of the text.

Supported Langauges: [`en`, `de`, `es`]

Returned labels:
* anger
* joy
* love
* sadness
* surprise
 * uncategorized
data.description_suggestion: Detects and classifies emotions expressed in text using a standard emotion model. Supports 3 languages: English, German, and Spanish. Returns emotion classification labels including anger, joy, love, sadness, surprise, and uncategorized. Each detected emotion is scored to indicate the confidence level of the classification.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate and action-oriented. Description has a typo ('Langauges') and lacks clarity about what the operation returns and how results are structured. data.current_description:
Detect the emotions of the text based on Ekman.

Supported Langauges: [`en`, `de`, `es`]

Returned labels:
* anger
* disgust
* fear
* joy
 * sadness
* surprise
* no-emotion
data.summary_suggestion: Analyze text emotions using Ekman model
data.description_suggestion: Detects and classifies emotions in text using Ekman's psychological emotion model, which identifies seven distinct emotion categories. Supports 3 languages: English, German, and Spanish. Returns emotion classification labels including anger, disgust, fear, joy, sadness, surprise, and no-emotion. Each emotion is scored to indicate confidence level of the classification.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Emotion Analysis' is identical to the standard emotion operation, creating confusion. Description has typo ('Langauges') and doesn't clarify the distinction from standard emotion analysis or explain the Ekman model. Enhanced summary to differentiate from standard emotion analysis and description to clarify the psychological framework and output structure.

data.current_description:
Predict the personality trait of author of any written text.
 
Supported Languages: [`ar`, `de`, `en`, `es`, `fr`, `it`, `nl`, `pt`, `ru`, `tr`, `zh`]

Returned labels:

* emotional
* rational
data.description_suggestion: Predicts the personality traits of a text's author by analyzing writing patterns and linguistic characteristics. Classifies authors into two personality dimensions: emotional or rational. Supports 11 languages: Arabic, German, English, Spanish, French, Italian, Dutch, Portuguese, Russian, Turkish, and Chinese. Returns personality classification labels with confidence scores indicating the likelihood of each personality trait.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description lacks clarity about what personality dimensions are returned and how results are structured. Enhanced description to clarify the binary personality classification, supported languages in readable format, and output structure for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_summary: Extracts topics and sentiments and relates them.
data.summary_suggestion: Extract topics and analyze their sentiment
data.description_suggestion: Identifies topics discussed in text and analyzes the sentiment expressed toward each topic. Combines topic extraction with sentiment analysis to provide a comprehensive understanding of what is being discussed and how it is being discussed. Returns topic-sentiment pairs showing the relationship between identified topics and their associated sentiment polarity (positive, negative, or neutral). Useful for understanding nuanced opinions about specific subjects within longer texts.

data.current_summary: Predicts whether a phrase is a promoter, detractor or indifferent
data.summary_suggestion: Classify customer sentiment as promoter, detractor, or neutral
data.description_suggestion: Analyzes customer feedback or reviews to classify them into Net Promoter Score (NPS) categories: promoter (likely to recommend), detractor (likely to discourage others), or indifferent (neutral stance). This pipeline operation combines sentiment analysis with NPS classification to assess customer loyalty and satisfaction. Returns classification labels indicating the customer's likelihood to promote or detract from a brand. Useful for customer feedback analysis and brand health monitoring.
data.reasoning: Summary is overly technical without context about NPS framework. Description is completely missing, leaving AI agents unable to understand the operation's purpose, domain context, or outputs. Enhanced summary to clarify the NPS classification context and added comprehensive description explaining the NPS framework, output structure, and business use cases.
